TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IToolbar

Docs.summary: This API supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddBitmap (int nImages, IntPtr hbmp, int cxSize, int cySize, int crMask);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddBitmap(int32 nImages, native int hbmp, int32 cxSize, int32 cySize, int32 crMask) cil managed
Public Sub AddBitmap (nImages As Integer, hbmp As IntPtr, cxSize As Integer, cySize As Integer, crMask As Integer)
public: void AddBitmap(int nImages, IntPtr hbmp, int cxSize, int cySize, int crMask);
abstract member AddBitmap : int * nativeint * int * int * int -> unit

Docs.param: An index of images that are available. A value that specifies the number of images in the bitmap being passed in .
A handle to the bitmap to be added to the toolbar.
The height, in pixels, of the bitmap to be added.
The width, in pixels, of the bitmap to be added.
The color used to generate a mask to overlay the images on the toolbar buttons.
Docs.summary: Enables a snap-in to add an image to the toolbar.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddButtons (int nButtons, ref Microsoft.CLRAdmin.MMCBUTTON lpButtons);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddButtons(int32 nButtons, valuetype Microsoft.CLRAdmin.MMCBUTTON& lpButtons) cil managed
Public Sub AddButtons (nButtons As Integer, ByRef lpButtons As MMCBUTTON)
public: void AddButtons(int nButtons, Microsoft::CLRAdmin::MMCBUTTON % lpButtons);
abstract member AddButtons : int * MMCBUTTON -> unit

Docs.param: The number of buttons in the array.
A pointer to the structure that contains information necessary for creating a button on the toolbar.
Docs.summary: Enables a snap-in to add an array of buttons to the toolbar.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DeleteButton (int nIndex);

Public Sub DeleteButton (nIndex As Integer)
public: void DeleteButton(int nIndex);

Docs.param: An index of the button to be removed from the toolbar.
Docs.summary: Enables a snap-in to remove a specified toolbar button.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetButtonState (int idCommand, Microsoft.CLRAdmin.MMC_BUTTON_STATE nState, out int pState);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void GetButtonState(int32 idCommand, class Microsoft.CLRAdmin.MMC_BUTTON_STATE nState, [out] int32& pState) cil managed
Public Sub GetButtonState (idCommand As Integer, nState As MMC_BUTTON_STATE, ByRef pState As Integer)
public: void GetButtonState(int idCommand, Microsoft::CLRAdmin::MMC_BUTTON_STATE ^ nState, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] int % pState);
abstract member GetButtonState : int * Microsoft.CLRAdmin.MMC_BUTTON_STATE * int -> unit

Docs.param: The command identifier of the toolbar button.

A value that identifies the possible states of the button. Can be one of the following: | Value | Description | | --- | --- | | ENABLED | The button accepts user input. A button that does not have this state does not accept user input and appears dimmed. | | CHECKED | The button has the CHECKED style and is being pressed. | | HIDDEN | The button is not visible and cannot receive user input. | | INDETERMINATE | The button appears dimmed. | | BUTTONPRESSED | The button is being pressed. |
A pointer to the state information that is returned.
Docs.summary: Enables a snap-in to obtain an attribute of a button.

MemberSignature.Value: public void InsertButton (int nIndex, ref Microsoft.CLRAdmin.MMCBUTTON lpButton);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void InsertButton(int32 nIndex, valuetype Microsoft.CLRAdmin.MMCBUTTON& lpButton) cil managed
Public Sub InsertButton (nIndex As Integer, ByRef lpButton As MMCBUTTON)
public: void InsertButton(int nIndex, Microsoft::CLRAdmin::MMCBUTTON % lpButton);
abstract member InsertButton : int * MMCBUTTON -> unit

Docs.param: An internal index at which the button will be inserted. The button is always placed at the end of the toolbar; the internal index is required if the button is to be deleted (by means of ).
A pointer to the structure that defines the button to be inserted.
Docs.summary: Enables a snap-in to add a single button to the toolbar. The button being added is placed at the end of the toolbar.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetButtonState (int idCommand, Microsoft.CLRAdmin.MMC_BUTTON_STATE nState, int bState);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetButtonState(int32 idCommand, class Microsoft.CLRAdmin.MMC_BUTTON_STATE nState, int32 bState) cil managed
Public Sub SetButtonState (idCommand As Integer, nState As MMC_BUTTON_STATE, bState As Integer)
public: void SetButtonState(int idCommand, Microsoft::CLRAdmin::MMC_BUTTON_STATE ^ nState, int bState);
abstract member SetButtonState : int * Microsoft.CLRAdmin.MMC_BUTTON_STATE * int -> unit

Docs.param: A unique value that the snap-in has associated with a button using the or method using the structure.

A value that specifies the state to be set for the button. Can be any one of the following: | Value | Description | | --- | --- | | ENABLED | The button accepts user input. A button that does not have this state does not accept user input and appears dimmed. | | CHECKED | The button has the CHECKED style and is being pressed. | | HIDDEN | The button is not visible and cannot receive user input. | | INDETERMINATE | The button appears dimmed. | | BUTTONPRESSED | The button is being pressed. |
A value that specifies whether the state identified in is set to or . sets the button state to the state identified by and clears the state (if it is already set).
Docs.summary: Enables a snap-in to set an attribute of a button.
